register.description: IP revision identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: IP revision

register.description: Information about the hardware configuration of the IP module; that is, typically, the HDL generics (if any) of the module.

bitfield.description: Response FIFO size
Number of contexts
Configuration of the local target state management mode. By definition, target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: An IDLE request is acknowledged unconditionally
An IDLE request is never acknowledged
Smart-idle mode. Acknowledgment to an IDLE request is given based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: Software reset.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

bitfield.description: Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.
Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.
Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.
Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.
Invalid access.
Invalid access.
Invalid access.
Invalid access.
Context has been fully transferred to the TILER
Context has been fully transferred to the TILER
Context has been fully transferred to the TILER
Write mode: Context has been fully transferred to the TILER Read mode: Context prefetch has completed.
Invalid access to the virtual space
OCP error received from OCP master port.

register.description: Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector. Enabled status is not set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced (raw status gets cleared, that is, even if not enabled).

bitfield.description: Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.

OCP error received from OCP master port.

register.description: Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.

bitfield.description: Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.

register.description: Per-event interrupt enable bit vector Write 1 to clear (disable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _SET register.

bitfield.description: Read request received before sufficient data has been prefetched.

Minimum number of OCP cycles between two consecutive buffer flushing or prefetch requests. Used to limit the bandwidth used to fill/empty buffers. 0: Maximum speed. Up to 1 request every 8 cycles (3.2GB @ 200 MHz) 1: Up to 1 request every 9 cycles. 1023: Minimum speed. Up to 1 request every 1031 cycles (24MB @ 200 MHz)
Base address of the virtual space translated by the BTE. Start address = BASE*512MB End address = (BASE+1)*512MB – 1 For example: BASE=3 =&gt; 0x 0 6000 0000 - 0x 0 7FFF FFFF
Select among posted and nonposted writes for translated requests.

BTE could use up to TAG_CNT+1 tags on OCPO. There could only be one outstanding request per tag. TAG_CNT does not control the number of requests it could handle on OCPI. This register is internally shadowed. Modifications are taken into account when there are no outstanding transactions on OCPO. TAG ID 0 to TAG_CNT are used on OCPO.
The BTE stops accepting new requests from OCPI (on a clean burst boundary) when the response FIFO contains more than RESP_FIFO_THR words. The reset value is FIFO_SIZE - 16 - 1. FIFO_SIZE = 8 * 2

Threshold used to trigger translated requests to OCPO. Unit: words or 16 bytes Valid range: 3 lines + 2 ... 4 lines WRITE: a 2D write is issued to OCPO when the internal buffer level (including masked accesses) is superior or equal to TRIGGER READ: a 2D read is issued to OCPO when the internal buffer level (including masked accesses) is inferior to TRIGGER.
Reset value to be used for SX__x. Check the section describing the local buffer management for details.
Reset value to be used for SY__x. Check the section describing the local buffer management for details. Must be 0 when ONESHOT = 0.
Controls the value of the OCP address bit 32 to be used for translated accesses
Controls automatic context flushing when an IDLE request is received
Selects one-shot or continuous mode

bitenum.description: The context is automatically re-enabled when its end is reached.
The context is disabled when the end of a frame has been reached.

bitfield.description: Grid used to access the TILER
Select the translation mode for the context
Flushes all remaining data of the context to the TILER.
Stops the context on a clean OCP transaction boundary.
Resets the contexts internal state and enables the context on a clean OCP transaction boundary.

Threshold used to trigger translated requests to OCPO. register.description: Address of the frame buffer in the TILER address space.
